title: Does Katy Perry write her own songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes and no. She has co-writing credits on almost every song she has ever released, but there are almost always co-writing credits given to other people as well. Now that she is a huge star, she has big name songwriters getting credit on a lot of what she puts out, so it is difficult to say whether she is REALLY contributing meaningfully to the songwriting.On the other hand, I get the impression that her early songs were almost entirely written by her directly.SIDE-NOTE: I’m pretty sure she wrote the core of “Chained to the Rhythm” on her own. That song and its fudged rollout have “pop star with a newly awakened social conscience” written all over them.

She cowrites most of them, so it's hard to say exactly how much is her and how much is other people.  She cowrote all of her big hits with other people. "Waking Up in Vegas" was written by Katy Perry, Desmond Child, Andreas Carlsson"I Kissed a Girl" was written by Katy Perry, Dr. Luke, Max Martin,Cathy Dennis"Ur So Gay" was written by Katy Perry and Greg Wells"Teenage Dream" was written by Katy Perry, Bonnie McKee, Benny Blanco, Max Martin, and Dr. Luke"California Gurls" was written by Katy Perry, Bonnie McKee, Snoop Dogg, Max Martin, and Dr. Luke Sources:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waking_Up_in_Vegashttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ur_So_Gayhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_Kissed_a_Girl
